metadata.title: CVE-2016-9064 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Add-on updates failed to verify that the add-on ID inside the signedpackage matched the ID of the add-on being updated. An attacker who couldperform a man-in-the-middle attack on the user's connection to the updateserver and defeat the certificate pinning protection could provide amalicious signed add-on instead of a valid update. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox ESR < 45.5 and Firefox < 50.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
